properties.areaDesc: Southern Black Hills; Wyoming Black Hills; Central Black Hills; Northern Black Hills
properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 31 at 1:46PM MST until February 4 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Rapid City SD
properties.description:
A storm system will move through the northern Rockies into the
four corners region from Sunday into Monday. A surface low will
develop over northeast Colorado and push into Kansas. Expect
increasing areas of snow Sunday night into Monday. Snow in excess
of 6 inches is possible across northeast Wyoming into the higher
Black Hills. Blowing snow should be patchy at best given only
modest wind speeds.

* WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations in excess
of 6 inches possible.

* WHERE...In Wyoming, the Wyoming Black Hills. In South Dakota,
the Northern Black Hills, the Central Black Hills and the
Southern Black Hills.

* WHEN...From Sunday evening through Monday evening.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Storm Watch means heavy snow, strong winds, freezing
precipitation, and cold temperatures are possible. Monitor NOAA
weather radio, local radio or television, or the Internet for
updates on this potentially dangerous storm.  Take time to
prepare for severe winter conditions before the storm develops.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING
